results.summary: A husband admits slitting the throat of his estranged wife at the family home after she asked for a divorce.
results.body: <body xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/53b011f7-3b98-ee40-b452-8bb8c731a483"><paragraph role="introduction">A husband has admitted murdering his estranged wife by cutting her throat after she asked for a divorce.</paragraph><paragraph>Shoukat Ali, 38, broke into the house in Farndon Road, Alum Rock, Birmingham where his wife lived with three of her five children.</paragraph><paragraph>Shaista Khatoon, 33, died in hospital after she was found collapsed at the property on 19 November.</paragraph><paragraph>Prosecutors described it as an "extremely tragic case" and a "brutal" killing.</paragraph><paragraph>Claire Nicholls, from West Midlands Crown Prosecution Service, said Ali was unable to accept his wife wanted a divorce.</paragraph><crosshead>'Angry and upset'</crosshead><paragraph>She said since their separation, he had launched a campaign of harassment and threats against his wife and their children.</paragraph><paragraph>Two days before the attack, Ali had received a divorce letter through the Islamic Court. </paragraph><paragraph>Ms Nicholls said: "Angry and upset with this, he broke into the family home and confronted the victim. </paragraph><paragraph>"Fearing for her safety, Mrs Khatoon tried to call her sister and the police, but Ali terminated the calls."</paragraph><paragraph>She said concerned family members then called the police, who arrived at the house to find Mrs Khatoon "lying in a pool of blood in the living room".</paragraph></body>

results.headline: Shoukat Ali murdered wife Shaista Khatoon over divorce
